alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 5:01PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 455 PM EDT, Earlier thunderstorms produced a large area of 2 and 3.5 inches of rain across North Charleston, Daniel Island, and the Interstate 526 corridor across Mount Pleasant. Spotter and public reports indicated a few roads remained covered in water, primarily from the Park Circle area north to the Naval Weapons Station. The water should gradually recede during the remainder of the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Daniel Island, West Ashley, Charleston Naval Complex, Riverfront Park, Park Circle, Wando Terminal, Snowden and Shadowmoss.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
